|cpu1chip1 = Atheros;AR9344; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 74Kc |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 560<!-- 560 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = 32-bit
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;FL256SAIFRO; |flash1size = 32 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = Nanya;NT5TU32M16DG-AC; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Atheros;AR8035-A; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 00:19:92 |oui = 00:19:92

|serial = yes, internal, 4-pin header, 3.3V TTL |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Atheros;AR9382; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "7016A0507001 Ver: 1.00" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :This is the same text found on the [[WatchGuard AP100]] ('''Senao''' CAP2100AG) and the [[Senao CAP4200AG]]. :A label affixed to the BSAP-1920 model (integral antennas) in the FCC external photos identifies the device as a CAP4200AG. :The BSAP-192x series are the same hardware, BSAP-1925 antennae are external and detachable RP-SMA, while the BSAP-1920 are internal.
*The 5GHz radio (AR9344) is using two [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=944 '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE2537L / 2537L Power Amplifier modules]. *The 2.4GHz radio (AR9382) is using two [https://www.microchip.com/wwwproducts/Devices.aspx?dDocName=en550350 '''Microchip''' ('''SST''') SST12LP15A 2.4GHz Power Amplifier modules].
The default credentials in this entry are per the FCC QSG. :They are specified as being for SSH access.
The power adapter shown in the FCC external photos is a '''Powertron Electronics''' PA1015-2I/PA1015-2I 120125 (100-240VAC ~ 50-60Hz, 0.4A -> 12VDC, 1.25A, 15W max.).
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== {{/Serial info}}
